bibl.title: Letter from Henry Hanson to Henry Rose Carter, [19--]

div1.p: Hanson requests a copy of Carter's article on the incubation period of yellow fever, from 1900.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Hanson to Henry Rose Carter, [19--]
div1.p:
The enclosed is a copy of the translation
made by us. I am sending another copy to Dr. Rose. They have
only translated the second lecture while we have had the
whole thing translated.

I should very much like to get a copy of your article
on the Extrinsic Incubation. I believe the title was,
“ A Note on the Interval Between Infecting and Secondary
Cases of Yellow Fever” New Orleans Medical and Surgical
Journal, May 1900.

Pickett has just come in from a tour of inspections of
the “Haciendas” to the east of us, and says that he finds conditions
better than he expected. 12% at Patapo.
